intro: Gymnosteris nudicaulis var. pulchella, commonly known as the slender gymnosteris, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and hairless, while its flowers are white or pale green, often clustered in small, flat-topped inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
